page.title: 18Customs-Geordie Day
page.content: {Geordie Day continued Local traditions are further remembered with quoits matches and old fashioned North East street games revived.Local school children dress up in 1920'scostumes to play marbles, cock-a-hoop and other favourites.The local pub hosts a variety of long forgotten pub pastimes. The past's link with the present is maintained with the grand pigeon release of 2000 birds and the locally popular whippet racing. A selection of brass band music is always listened to with great interest as the brass band is still held in great affection in the North East. This link with the past is one of the major regional attractions and its future at Beamish is assured for the forseeable future.
